channel.title: Forward?
channel.description: What's the point of forwarding? Why not just put the procedure in the forward spot?

item.title: Forward?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

The Un-Named:

The problem with putting a procedure in front of another procedure is that, if your working on a complex script, you could have 3 procedures all needed to access each other, and you can’t move them around so it compiles.

Ahh, that makes sense, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Forward?
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Forwarding is for when you NEED to use a procedure which is declared below the procedure your using it in;
For example;
Recently I was working on 2 procedures;
One which You put in 2 variables and it returns the roadcolour and a DDTM(It was for walking from fally to draynor)
But I needed the RoadColour to make the DDTM;
and I needed the DDTM to make the variable in the function, So I forwarded it xP.

Basically if you can’t just put a procedure above another one, You need to forward it, Otherwise you won’t be able to access it

Read full topic
